Namespace forward

Functions

  • attribute

Functions

attribute

  • attribute(__namedParameters: { alpha: Alpha; name: string; simulations: DataFrame; startIndex?: number }): Serie

  • Compute an attribute by superposition given some predefined simulations

    example
    import { DataFrame, Serie } from '@youwol/dataframe'
import { simpleAndersonMapping, forward } from '@youwol/geophysics'

let df = DataFrame.create({
     series: {
         'toto2': Serie.create({array: ..., itemSize: 3}),
         'toto3': Serie.create({array: ..., itemSize: 3}),
         'toto4': Serie.create({array: ..., itemSize: 3})
     }
})

const a = forward.attribute({
     simulations: df,
     alpha      : simpleAndersonMapping([45, 1.2]),
     name       : 'toto',
     startIndex : 2
})

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { alpha: Alpha; name: string; simulations: DataFrame; startIndex?: number }
      • alpha: Alpha

        The Alpha parameter to perform the linear combination

      • name: string

        The prefix of the series in the [[Dataframe]]

      • simulations: DataFrame

        The dataframe containing al the necessary simulations

      • Optional startIndex?: number

        The starting index which concatenate to the name gives the name of the first [[Serie]]. Default value is 1

    Returns Serie

    A new [[Serie]] which is the linear combination of the provided series
